definition: always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: She never learned how to read a milometer,or any meter.
sentences.chinese: 不管是里程錶，還是什麼表，她從來就不會看。

sentences.english: Although it is not expensive, we never seem to have quite enough money.
sentences.chinese: 雖然這是不昂貴的，我們從來沒有，似乎已很夠了錢。

sentences.english: We never made a purchase on credit.
She was never flighty like you.
sentences.chinese: 她從來不像你這樣胡思亂想。

sentences.english: Chinese people has never regarded human beings as the hightest creature among everything else since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 中華民族自古以來從來不把人看作高於一切。

sentences.english: Those are only our decoration, coz we never follow the money.
sentences.chinese: 那只是偶們的裝飾品，偶們從來不會被錢奴役。

sentences.english: You never actually stood there and looked up at that beautiful ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 你從來沒有真正地站在那裏，看那美麗的天花板。

sentences.english: The path has never been perfect.
sentences.chinese: 道路從來不可能總是平坦的通途。

sentences.english: This child never felt so well as when he was in the street.
sentences.chinese: 這孩子從來就只覺得街上纔是他安身的地方。

sentences.english: But Ryan Reser of the U.S. judo team has never been to the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 但是這位美國柔道選手以前從來沒有參加過奧運比賽。

sentences.english: You were never just my queen,Clarisse.
sentences.chinese: 你從來就不只是我的女王。

sentences.english: Right. I have witnessed some applications that in fact rarely or never throw exceptions.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我知道有些應用程序極少或從來不會拋出異常。

sentences.english: In history, the overpopulation problem has never been so stand out like now.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上，人口過剩的問題從來沒有比現在更加突出。

sentences.english: I have never eaten it, even heard it.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒喫過它甚至連聽都沒聽說過。

sentences.english: He never got to the office late, like some important officials did, and he never procrastinated on any official duties.
sentences.chinese: 他從來就不像一些大官那樣遲到，更不會延誤公務。

sentences.english: The window is never open except in summer.
sentences.chinese: 這扇窗戶從來不開，夏季除外。

definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
